Rem (Re:Zero)
Rem is a supporting character from Tappei Nagatsuki's isekai web / light novel Re:Zero. She is a one-horned oni and the blue-haired twin sister of Ram, and serves as one of the housemaids of Roswaal's mansion. 
Rem became a breakout character in the fandom because of her moment in the anime's season 1 episode 18, which cemented her progress from being Subaru Natsuki's murderer to becoming his most devoted lover. In the episode, she confesses her feelings in painstaking detail to a despairing Subaru, who just wants to give up and run away. Although he "rejects" her afterwards by saying "he loves Emilia" to her face (which she accepts anyway), Rem's inspiring speech succeeded in convincing him to "start over from zero", face his problems, and strive towards becoming the greatest hero that she has ever seen. Since that episode, the blue oni has experienced a dramatic rise in popularity and fan arts, to the point of overshadowing the novel's designated main heroine.
In the context of saimoe tournaments, Rem is undeniably the most successful waifu EVER, due to her sheer record-setting number of over 100 contest victories (recognized by this wiki's editors) as of this time of writing, and shows no signs of stopping soon. For reference, her closest competitor and fellow "G.O.A.T" candidate, Mikoto Misaka, has won barely half of that amount. Furthermore, Rem also holds a special distinction for being the only girl to win Bilibili Moe (in 2016), the International Saimoe League (in 2018), and /r/anime's Best Girl Contest (in 2018) - three of the biggest character tounaments in terms of voter turnout at the time. She also won the Korean Aniplus tournament in 2016 (considered the nominal successor of Anizone saimoe), and has consistently made the final rounds in subsequent appearances.

ISML Profile Flavor Text
 
(written by Momento10)
If only she was not around. If only she never thought those selfish thoughts that fateful day. If only she never existed.
For the longest time, Rem suffered from an inferiority complex. No matter what she did, she could never measure up to the caliber of her genius older sister that everyone wanted her to be. In her head, all she heard was the subtext of the sugar-coated phrases dumped at her. And the one moment when she found solace from her inner demons, she does what she believed was the most unatonable sin imaginable: wishing her elder sister never existed.
Time moves on, and she finally reached a point where she can claim to be better than her sister in every category: cooking, cleaning, medicine, fighting. But, she never wanted grow this way. Every day was a day of success and agony. She felt more in debt with her sister, and her inferiority towards her began to rise exponentially. She came to the conclusion that her growth would be her punishment. The sentence of her crimes can only be paid with her life.
The sun rises, and Rem starts the day with a forced smile, hoping that, one day, she can smile genuinely just like did before everything turned awry.
